topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Disabling the Root User

body.p: For security purposes, we strongly recommend disabling root. After the root user is disabled, you can use another default user account, cghelion to access the HLM VM and any actions that require root access should be done using sudo.
Execute the following command to run a script that disables the root user.
This command will disable the root user and performs the following tasks:

ul.li: removes password for root from the /etc/shadow file
removes any and all keys in /root/.ssh/authorized_keys file
changes PermitRootLogin in /etc/ssh/sshd_config file from "yes" back to default of "without-password"
restarts the ssh service so the above config change takes effect immediately

body.p: Once this command complete, the cghelion user should be used .
Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
